Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entity
      • Animal
  • public class Animal
extends Entity
    The class Animal handles all the animals' functions and what they do. It extends from the class Entity.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Entity

        name, playerNo, rank, x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Animal​(int x, int y, int p, java.lang.String n)
      This constructor calls the super class Entity with the x and y direction values of the animal, the player number of the animal, and the name of the animal.
      Animal​(int r, java.lang.String n)
      This constructor is used for the randomization before the start of the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean capture​(Animal a)
      This method handles the capture mechanic.
      boolean ifOutOfBounds​(int x, int y)
      This method checks a boolean value if a specific direction is out of bounds of the board.
      int MoveDown()
      This method returns the updated direction whenever the animal is going down.
      int MoveLeft()
      This method returns the updated direction whenever the animal is going left.
      int MoveRight()
      This method returns the updated direction whenever the animal is going right.
      int MoveUp()
      This method returns the updated direction whenever the animal is going up.
      void updateXY​(int x, int y)
      This method updates the x and y values of the animal.
      Animal whichAnimal()
      This method determines what subclass of Animal is a particular, specific instance.

      • Methods inherited from class Entity

        getPNum, getRank, getX, getY, toString

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animal

        public Animal​(int x,
              int y,
              int p,
              java.lang.String n)
        This constructor calls the super class Entity with the x and y direction values of the animal, the player number of the animal, and the name of the animal.
        Parameters:
        x - x value direction of the animal
        y - y value direction of the animal
        p - player number of the animal
        n - name of the animal

      • Animal

        public Animal​(int r,
              java.lang.String n)
        This constructor is used for the randomization before the start of the game. Only requires rank and name.
        Parameters:
        r - rank of the animal
        n - name of the animal

    • Method Detail

      • MoveUp

        public int MoveUp()
        This method returns the updated direction whenever the animal is going up.
        Returns:
        updated x value that makes the animal go up in the board

      • MoveDown

        public int MoveDown()
        This method returns the updated direction whenever the animal is going down.
        Returns:
        updated x value that makes the animal go down in the board

      • MoveLeft

        public int MoveLeft()
        This method returns the updated direction whenever the animal is going left.
        Returns:
        updated y value that makes the animal go left in the board

      • MoveRight

        public int MoveRight()
        This method returns the updated direction whenever the animal is going right.
        Returns:
        updated y value that makes the animal go right in the board

      • updateXY

        public void updateXY​(int x,
                     int y)
        This method updates the x and y values of the animal.
        Parameters:
        x - the new x value to replace the old value
        y - the new y value to replace the old value

      • ifOutOfBounds

        public boolean ifOutOfBounds​(int x,
                             int y)
        This method checks a boolean value if a specific direction is out of bounds of the board.
        Parameters:
        x - the x direction of the animal that is out of bounds
        y - the y direction of the animal that is out of bounds
        Returns:
        check to indicate if it's true or false

      • capture

        public boolean capture​(Animal a)
        This method handles the capture mechanic. It gets the two animals in conflict and compares their ranks. Whichever has the higher rank wins and captures the other.
        Parameters:
        a - First animal
        Returns:
        boolean that will determine who won

      • whichAnimal

        public Animal whichAnimal()
        This method determines what subclass of Animal is a particular, specific instance.
        Returns:
        the subclass of the animal that it is
